entry.title: https://github.com/CliMA/ClimaAtmos.jl
entry.content: ClimaAtmos.jl is a library for building atmospheric circulation models that is designed from the outset to leverage data assimilation and machine learning tools. We welcome contributions!

entry.title: https://github.com/EnzymeAD/Reactant.jl
entry.content: Optimize Julia Functions With MLIR and XLA for High-Performance Execution on CPU, GPU, TPU and more.

entry.title: https://github.com/JuliaParallel/Dagger.jl
entry.content: A framework for out-of-core and parallel execution

entry.title: https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General
entry.content: The official registry of general Julia packages

entry.title: https://github.com/LuxDL/Lux.jl
entry.content: Elegant and Performant Scientific Machine Learning in Julia

entry.title: https://github.com/NREL-Sienna/PowerSystems.jl
entry.content: Data structures in Julia to enable power systems analysis. Part of the Scalable Integrated Infrastructure Planning Initiative at the National Renewable Energy Lab.

entry.title: https://github.com/SciML/Catalyst.jl
entry.content: Chemical reaction network and systems biology interface for scientific machine learning (SciML). High performance, GPU-parallelized, and O(1) solvers in open source software.

entry.title: https://github.com/SciML/ModelingToolkit.jl
entry.content: An acausal modeling framework for automatically parallelized scientific machine learning (SciML) in Julia. A computer algebra system for integrated symbolics for physics-informed machine learning and automated transformations of differential equations

entry.title: https://github.com/SciML/ModelingToolkitStandardLibrary.jl
entry.content: A standard library of components to model the world and beyond

entry.title: https://github.com/SciML/NeuralPDE.jl
entry.content: Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) Solvers of (Partial) Differential Equations for Scientific Machine Learning (SciML) accelerated simulation

entry.title: https://github.com/SciML/NonlinearSolve.jl
entry.content: High-performance and differentiation-enabled nonlinear solvers (Newton methods), bracketed rootfinding (bisection, Falsi), with sparsity and Newton-Krylov support.

entry.title: https://github.com/SciML/Optimization.jl
entry.content: Mathematical Optimization in Julia. Local, global, gradient-based and derivative-free. Linear, Quadratic, Convex, Mixed-Integer, and Nonlinear Optimization in one simple, fast, and differentiable interface.

entry.title: https://github.com/SciML/StructuralIdentifiability.jl
entry.content: Fast and automatic structural identifiability software for ODE systems
